result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcello A. Willis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcello A. Willis in court.  Prosecuting attorney Rosa Delgado in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: DE is not eligible for SPD and is given advocate counsel paperwork today.   DE waives time for the preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. 
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: LHG, JHM, Alexis M, Bain School.  NO VIOLENT contact and no discussion of case w/ Katrina H. The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

2:14 PM
Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Gardner. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am. $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). ec
and witness list filed by the State
